Package com.shelfsync.exceptions

Class GlobalExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
com.shelfsync.exceptions.GlobalExceptionHandler
@RestControllerAdvice public class GlobalExceptionHandler extends Object
Global exception handler for the ShelfSync application.

This class provides centralized exception handling for all REST controllers. It converts application exceptions into appropriate HTTP responses using Spring's ProblemDetail format (RFC 7807).

Handled exceptions:

  • ResourceNotFoundException - Returns HTTP 404 (Not Found)
  • ResourceConflictException - Returns HTTP 409 (Conflict)
  • IllegalArgumentException - Returns HTTP 400 (Bad Request) with full error logging

All exception responses include:

  • HTTP status code appropriate for the exception type
  • Title describing the error category
  • Detail message from the exception
  • Request path where the error occurred

    • handleNotFound

      @ExceptionHandler(ResourceNotFoundException.class) public org.springframework.http.ProblemDetail handleNotFound(ResourceNotFoundException ex, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles ResourceNotFoundException by returning an HTTP 404 response.
      Parameters:
      ex - The ResourceNotFoundException that was thrown
      request - The HTTP request that triggered the exception
      Returns:
      A ProblemDetail with HTTP 404 status and exception message

    • handleIllegalArgument

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.IllegalArgumentException.class) public org.springframework.http.ProblemDetail handleIllegalArgument(IllegalArgumentException ex, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles IllegalArgumentException by returning an HTTP 400 response.

      This handler logs the full exception details (including stack trace) for debugging purposes, while returning a user-friendly message to the client. This is particularly useful for business rule violations (e.g., capacity exceeded, negative quantities).

      Parameters:
      ex - The IllegalArgumentException that was thrown
      request - The HTTP request that triggered the exception
      Returns:
      A ProblemDetail with HTTP 400 status and exception message
